entries.meaning: (biology) Any portion taken from a plant or an animal that will be used to initiate a culture. It can be a portion of the shoot, or of the leaves, or even just some cells.

verbs.description: explant (third-person singular simple present explants, present participle explanting, simple past and past participle explanted)

entries.meaning: (medicine) To remove something, such as a medical device, that has been implanted.
